qas.question: How long ago were the earliest artifacts from that were evidence of humans in Iran?

answers.text: the Lower Paleolithic era, c. 800,000–200,000 BC

qas.question: What region of Iran did Neanderthal artifacts from the Middle Paleolithic Period were found?
When did early agricultural communities in Iran begin to appear and prosper?
What were dug up from the archaeological sites Kashafrud and Ganj Par in Iran?

answers.text: The earliest archaeological artifacts in Iran

context: <a3_0>The earliest archaeological artifacts in Iran<a3_0/>, like those excavated at the Kashafrud and Ganj Par sites, attest to a human presence in Iran since <a0_0>the Lower Paleolithic era, c. 800,000–200,000 BC<a0_0/>. Iran's Neanderthal artifacts from the Middle Paleolithic period, c. 200,000–40,000 BC, have been found mainly in <a1_0>the Zagros region<a1_0/>, at sites such as Warwasi and Yafteh Cave.[page needed] Around <a2_0>10th to 8th millennium BC<a2_0/>, early agricultural communities such as Chogha Golan and Chogha Bonut began to flourish in Iran, as well as Susa and Chogha Mish developing in and around the Zagros region.[page needed]
